name: Apple Upside-Down Cake
author: Amber
summary: This apple upside-down cake is a wonderful twist on an old favorite. Will have your mouth watering as it bakes, because it smells as good as it tastes! Large and tasty enough for family gatherings, potlucks, parties, etc.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups brown sugar, or more to taste
5 medium apples - peeled, cored, and sliced
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Cover the bottom of a 10x15-inch baking pan with brown sugar and 2 tablespoons cinnamon
Place flour, apple juice, white sugar, butter, eggs, milk, remaining 1 tablespoon cinnamon, vanilla extract, baking powder, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment
Mix until completely smooth, 5 to 10 minutes; the longer you mix, the fluffier the cake will be
Pour batter over apples in the baking pan, making sure they are evenly covered
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 55 minutes
Place a large serving dish over the cake and carefully flip over
